intro: Phacelia mammillarensis, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountain ranges in California. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
